entry.title: INSIDE DOUGLAS COUNTY 9.19.25
entry.summary: Julie and Chris Lowe of Umpqua Watersheds talk about Umpqua Brewfest, happening on Saturday. Then we hear from Umpqua Valley Arts Exhibitons Coordinator Ashley Cluver talk about things happening at the Arts Center.

entry.title: Business Oregon Receives $29 Million to Expand Access to Capital for Small Businesses
entry.summary: To support investments in Oregon’s small business ecosystem, Business Oregon has received $29 million through the State Small Business Credit Initiative (SSBCI). These funds will be deployed through business loans, loan guarantees, and equity investments to strengthen existing finance programs and expand access to capital for startups and growing businesses across the state. This funding… The post Business Oregon Receives $29 Million to Expand Access to Capital for Small Businesses appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.

entry.title: After nearly 2 decades, Winston's Now N Then Antique Mall is closing for good

entry.title: Winston-Dillard Melon Festival Kicks Off Friday With Full Weekend of Events
entry.summary: The 56th Winston-Dillard Melon Festival runs Sept. 19–21 with parades, live music, contests, kids’ games, food, and more. Highlights include the parade Sept. 20 at 11 a.m., music from Strange Birds, Trip Wire, and Borrowed Time, plus the grand raffle on Sunday.

entry.title: VA puts limit on COVID-19 shots pending CDC guidance

entry.title: Myrtle Creek Police Investigating Robbery Outside Bank
entry.summary: Myrtle Creek Police are investigating a Sunday night robbery outside Columbia Bank. A man reported two masked suspects stole a deposit and threatened to shoot him before fleeing on foot. Anyone with info is asked to call MCPD at 440-4471.

entry.title: Man Arrested After Escaping From Douglas County Courthouse
entry.summary: Deputies arrested 38-year-old Jesse Dewbre after he fled the Douglas County Courthouse Tuesday when a judge ordered him into custody. He was later found at his home and surrendered. Dewbre faces escape and warrant charges; bail set at $100,000.
